abstract: Tyler Hicks, a staff photographer at The New York Times, has been photographing the war in Afghanistan for over 10 years. Here's why he keeps going back.
snippet: Tyler Hicks, a staff photographer at The New York Times, has been photographing the war in Afghanistan for over 10 years. Here's why he keeps going back.
lead_paragraph: "I am a photographer working for a newspaper, and to ignore this American war, or any other war that we are involved in, would be an unfulfilling way for me to work." Tyler Hicks, a staff photographer at The New York Times, voices in a simple and understated way the reasons he keeps going back to Afghanistan after over 10 years of covering the war there. But his experiences in that time have been anything but simple or understated.

headline.main: Lens: Photographs From a Decade in Afghanistan
